Message.Msg: Hmmm . . . I thought you started shorting AMZN several months ago around 220. Yes, you added some after AMZN's price way exceeded your average short price, but you covered 800 shares at 242.50 earlier this week. Before covering your average short cover price was about 247, but buy eliminating 800 shares from somewhat higher prices, you effectively lowered your average short price. The last time I saw your total number of short shares, it was 7,100 before covering 800 shares. Then you shorted 300 shares at 255.49 two days ago. So you have 6,600 shares and still in the red on average. Blind chimps could have done better.

Message.Title: Massive short covering on AMZN today.
Message.Msg: Lots of traders made an overnight bet yesterday hoping AMZN would tank along with EBAY today. While EBAY is not soaring (it's flat to slightly down), those shorts have no choice but to cover today because they made an overnight bet and they got it wrong. They don't magically turn into "long-term investors" like shorts here, just because their bets turn out to be losers.

Message.Title: DRAM $0.6 Today Announced the Kick-off of its Partnership with AMD for Making AMD’s Superfast Radeon RAMDisks . AMD’s Radeon Extravaganza Event will be held on October 20, 2012. DRAM will make the AMD’s Radeon RAMDisks targeting gaming enthusiasts initially. Other applications requiring superfast processing will be announced later. This is a HUGE deal for tiny DRAM.
Message.Msg: 12- month target: $3++…….Sleepy Multi-bagger in the making DRAM with only 5M share float and $6 million market cap is super-undervalued trading at a 0.15 X Sales. The company was almost break-even before this gigantic news for tiny DRAM. The company has a strong balance sheet and ZERO debt. The new Radeon products will increase processing speeds by over 500% vs. conventional products. These products are initially aimed at the growing gaming industry but could be extrapolated to complex engineering simulation programs and other applications requiring super fast processing speeks DRAM could be a multi-bagger from here and it currently has no downside at today's rock-bottom prices Today 10/18/2012 DRAM news: Dataram to Attend AMD Radeon™ ExtravaLANza Wed, Oct 17, 2012 12:30 PM EDT PRINCETON, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Dataram Corporation (DRAM), a leading international manufacturer of computer memory, storage and software products, is proud to announce its participation at the AMD inaugural Radeon™ ExtravaLANza event on October 20, 2012 in support of the launch of AMD Radeon™ RAMDisk. The company recently announced a formal agreement with AMD to develop an AMD-branded version of its Dataram RAMDisk™, marketing the product under the name Radeon™ RAMDisk and offering gaming enthusiasts the ability to improve load times for a substantially enhanced gaming experience. Dataram representatives will be demonstrating the performance of Radeon™ RAMDisk and interacting directly with end users to answer questions and dialog about their experience with the product. Dataram will also be giving away free Radeon™ RAMDisk licenses to those end users who demonstrate the highest-performing and most creative uses of the product. The event, taking place in Markham, ON, Canada from Noon to 6:00 PM, is an opportunity to visit AMD’s Canadian headquarters and talk to some of AMD's leading global hardware and software partners. New technologies will be showcased and attendees will have an opportunity to win some great prizes. About Dataram Founded in 1967, Dataram is a worldwide leader in the manufacture of high-quality computer memory, storage and software products. Our products and services deliver IT infrastructure optimization, dramatically increase application performance and deliver substantial cost savings. Dataram solutions are deployed in 70 Fortune 100 companies and in mission-critical government and defense applications around the world. About AMD AMD (AMD) is a semiconductor design innovator leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its groundbreaking AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs) that power a wide range of computing devices. AMD’s server computing products are focused on driving industry-leading cloud computing and virtualization environments. AMD’s superior graphics technologies are found in a variety of solutions ranging from game consoles, PCs to supercomputers

Topic.Title: oh no ! the sky is falling rigth Coingiver? lmfao!! b/c a Burritio Company cracks! lol!

Message.Msg: The difference is that CMG has the unit economics and cash flow to do well in virtually any market environment. I can see several scenarios in which AMZN goes bankrupt in the next year. Seriously. 1) Google and Apple will match on content prices with vastly larger user bases and ecosystems. Thus, Amazon's key source of cash flow is in trouble. 2) IBM/ATT, Google, Oracle all going after AWS from above and Rackspace and others are coming at it from below. 3) WalMart, BestBuy and Target all matching prices this holiday season while Amazon has to collect tax for the first time. 4) Amazon has sunk a ton of money into the Kindle Fire. It really is only distinctive in the e-book reader segment... Unlike other categories of product, it doesn't get negative working capital benefit on its proprietary product (on which it makes no money). 5) Apple, Samsung and others SHOULD demand 30-45 days and cease to allow Amazon to operate on negative working capital. That alone would wreak havoc for a company with $11B in current assets and current liabilities.... Have fun longs. You are screwed.... As I said, this will see $100 by year end 2013...

Message.Msg: Tech: you fail to distinguish between fun and price. It's fun to shop on Amazon, read the reviews, maybe even write one. It's a chore shopping at Walmart, worst buy or any book store. You also fail to understand burn out. I rarely eat at Chipotle. Great food, I am just tired of it. Each place looks the same. And they're all too noisy. CMG is a great short. One day AMZN will go down too, but it will be the last to go down and first to go up. AMZN is at the front of a paradigm shift (electronic books). This post was written on an iPhone 5.

Topic.Title: oh no ! the sky is falling rigth Coingiver? lmfao!! b/c a Burritio Company cracks! lol!

Message.Msg: AMZN "the creme de la creme of stocks!"? A Google type cratering in AMZN's stock is built into it once reality sinks in. Just shows that PIGS CAN fly, until they can't. LMAO. I will chock your deranged post up to that of one who belongs to the masses of the delusional who somehow (laughably) believe AMZN is worth every penney of its incredibly bloated valuation.

Topic.Title: oh no ! the sky is falling rigth Coingiver? lmfao!! b/c a Burritio Company cracks! lol!

Message.Msg: Cmg was a great short at 440 i shorted it at 370, nflx was a great short at 300 i shorted it at 240 amzn is the greatest short at this level i shorted it at 234, as i was patient with the others and waited out all the craziness i will do the same thing here.

Topic.Title: oh no ! the sky is falling rigth Coingiver? lmfao!! b/c a Burritio Company cracks! lol!

Message.Msg: Edison: You have to make sure no one put grain alcohol in the kool aid before drinking so much... Amazon does not own the content and will have a small share of the screen displaying the content. Traditional e-books are a relatively small market opportunity and one that will be cannibalized by Apple and Google, amongst others. CMG is low on the list of good shorts at this point. I suspect you will see internal rotation tomorrow. Same with GOOG. There are MUCH better shorts, with this literally being the best -- even if it hits earnings out of the park and magically squeezes... I'm going to rather enjoy hearing Amazon argue how its model is better than Google's new paid product search, which is FAR more capital efficient and much better aligned to the incentive of traditional retailers. And Google has 500M GPS/location enabled devices to make it work... Anyone with a brain is selling Amazon tomorrow and buying Google.

Topic.Title: oh no ! the sky is falling rigth Coingiver? lmfao!! b/c a Burritio Company cracks! lol!

Message.Msg: They ought to do that (sell Amazon and buy Google) in a big way pre-market, killing the Google puts and driving up the IV in a huge way for Amazon just before earnings... Wish I had taken a flyer on some Oct 20 $235 puts before close...

Topic.Title: Loox like a bonifide reversal, biatchez...

Message.Msg: Sybs, AMZN put it's head up over the 250 gopher hole...only to be met with my big ol' shorting shovel! But she fell like a brick before I had a chance to give her another whack. Might never see 250 again. - PJ

Topic.Title: Loox like a bonifide reversal, biatchez...

Message.Msg: Well, I added a total of 50 contracts today. I'll adjust strikes on any stupid move up, but the truth of the matter is the MMs will make the most money by gapping down to $235 or so and taking it between there and $240 all day. Will max IV premium for earnings next week...
